extends java.lang.Object

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ActivateField(java.lang.String fieldName)
      ActivateField allows queries to retrieve data for the argument-specified field.
      void ActivateMultipleFields(SiebelPropertySet fields)
      Use ActivateMultipleFields to activate data for the fields specified in the property set.
      void Associate(int whereIndicator)
      The Associate method creates a new many-to-many relationship for the parent object through an association business component.
      void ClearToQuery()
      The ClearToQuery method clears the current query but does not clear sort specifications on the BusComp.
      int CountRecords()
      CountRecords uses database aggregation to count the records returned by the last ExecuteQuery() call.
      void DeactivateFields()
      DeactivateFields deactivates the fields that are currently active from a business component SQL query statement, except those that are not ForceActive, required for a link, or required by the BusComp class.
      void DeleteRecord()
      DeleteRecord removes the current record from the business component.
      void ExecuteQuery(int cursorMode)
      ExecuteQuery returns a set of business component records using the criteria established with methods such as SetSearchSpec.
      boolean FirstRecord()
      FirstRecord moves the record pointer to the first record in a business component, making that record current and invoking any associated script events.

      GetFieldValue returns the value for the field specified in its argument for the current record of the business component.
      java.lang.String GetFormattedFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
      GetFormattedFieldValue returns the field value in the current local format; it returns values in the same format as the Siebel UI.

      The Name property contains the name of the business component.

      NewRecord adds a new record (row) to the business component.

      NextRecord moves the record pointer to the next record in the business component, making that the current record and invoking any associated script events.
      SiebelBusComp ParentBusComp()
      ParentBusComp returns the parent (master) business component when given the child (detail) business component of a Link.
      void Pick()
      The Pick method places the currently selected record in a picklist business component into the appropriate fields of the parent business component.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SiebelBusComp

        public SiebelBusComp()

    • Method Detail

      • Name

        public java.lang.String Name()
        The Name property contains the name of the business component.
        Returns:
        A string containing the business component name

      • ActivateField

        public void ActivateField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        ActivateField allows queries to retrieve data for the argument-specified field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String variable or literal containing the name of the field to activate

      • ActivateMultipleFields

        public void ActivateMultipleFields(SiebelPropertySet fields)
        Use ActivateMultipleFields to activate data for the fields specified in the property set.
        Parameters:
        fields - Property set containing a collection of properties representing the fields that are to be activated.

      • Associate

        public void Associate(int whereIndicator)
        The Associate method creates a new many-to-many relationship for the parent object through an association business component.
        Parameters:
        This - argument should be one of the following predefined constants: NewBefore or NewAfter, as in NewRecord.

      • ClearToQuery

        public void ClearToQuery()
        The ClearToQuery method clears the current query but does not clear sort specifications on the BusComp.

      • CountRecords

        public int CountRecords()
        CountRecords uses database aggregation to count the records returned by the last ExecuteQuery() call.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the number of records returned by the last ExecuteQuery() call

      • DeactivateFields

        public void DeactivateFields()
        DeactivateFields deactivates the fields that are currently active from a business component SQL query statement, except those that are not ForceActive, required for a link, or required by the BusComp class.

      • DeleteRecord

        public void DeleteRecord()
        DeleteRecord removes the current record from the business component.

      • ExecuteQuery

        public void ExecuteQuery(int cursorMode)
        ExecuteQuery returns a set of business component records using the criteria established with methods such as SetSearchSpec.
        Parameters:
        cursorMode - An integer. An optional argument that must be one of the following constants (provided in Siebel VB as well as COM Servers):
        • ForwardBackward. Selected records can be processed from first to last or from last to first. This is the default if no value is specified.
        • ForwardOnly. Selected records can be processed only from the first record to the last record. Focus cannot return to a record.

      • FirstRecord

        public boolean FirstRecord()
        FirstRecord moves the record pointer to the first record in a business component, making that record current and invoking any associated script events.
        Returns:
        if there was a first record (the query returned results) true/false

      • GetFieldValue

        public java.lang.String GetFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        GetFieldValue returns the value for the field specified in its argument for the current record of the business component. Use this method to access a field value.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String variable or literal containing the name of the field
        Returns:
        A string containing the field value of the field identified in FieldName, an error message if the field is inactive, or an empty string if the field is empty.

      • GetFormattedFieldValue

        public java.lang.String GetFormattedFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        GetFormattedFieldValue returns the field value in the current local format; it returns values in the same format as the Siebel UI.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String variable or literal containing the name of the field to obtain the value from
        Returns:
        A string containing the value of the requested field, in the same format as displayed in the user interface, or an empty string ("") if the field is inactive or empty.

      • GetMVGBusComp

        public SiebelBusComp GetMVGBusComp(java.lang.String fieldName)
        The GetMVGBusComp method returns the MVG business component associated with the business component field specified by FieldName. This business component can be used to operate on the multi-value group using the normal business component mechanisms.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of the field with a multi-value group attached, used to obtain the mult-value group business component
        Returns:
        The multi-value group business component of the current business component and identified field

      • GetNamedSearch

        public java.lang.String GetNamedSearch(java.lang.String searchName)
        GetNamedSearch returns the named search specification specified by searchName.
        Parameters:
        searchName - Name of the search specification that references the search string.
        Returns:
        A string containing the value specified in the search specification identified in searchName

      • GetPicklistBusComp

        public SiebelBusComp GetPicklistBusComp(java.lang.String fieldName)
        GetPicklistBusComp returns the pick business component associated with the specified field in the current business component.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of the field with a picklist specified; used to obtain the pick business component
        Returns:
        The pick business component of the current business component and identified field. If there is no picklist associated with that field, the function returns an error.

      • GetSearchExpr

        public java.lang.String GetSearchExpr()
        GetSearchExpr returns the current search expression for the business component.
        Returns:
        A string containing the current search expression.

      • GetSearchSpec

        public java.lang.String GetSearchSpec(java.lang.String fieldName)
        GetSearchSpec returns the search specification for the field specified by the FieldName argument.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Contains the name of the field from which to obtain the associated search specification.
        Returns:
        A string containing the search specification for the field identified in FieldName.

      • GetViewMode

        public int GetViewMode()
        GetViewMode returns the current visibility mode for the business component. This effects which records are returned by queries according to the visibility rules.
        Returns:
        An integer constant that identifies a visibility mode

      • InvokeMethod

        public void InvokeMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                java.lang.String args)
        InvokeMethod calls the specialized method or user-created method named in the argument.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method.
        args - A single string or a string array (object interfaces) containing arguments to methodName.

      • LastRecord

        public boolean LastRecord()
        LastRecord moves the record pointer to the last record in the business component.
        Returns:

      • NewRecord

        public void NewRecord(int whereIndicator)
        NewRecord adds a new record (row) to the business component.
        Parameters:
        whereIndicator - Predefined constant indicating where the new row is added. This value should be one of the following:
        • NewBefore
        • NewAfter

      • NextRecord

        public boolean NextRecord()
        NextRecord moves the record pointer to the next record in the business component, making that the current record and invoking any associated script events.
        Returns:

      • ParentBusComp

        public SiebelBusComp ParentBusComp()
        ParentBusComp returns the parent (master) business component when given the child (detail) business component of a Link.
        Returns:
        The parent business component of the Link

      • Pick

        public void Pick()
        The Pick method places the currently selected record in a picklist business component into the appropriate fields of the parent business component.

      • PreviousRecord

        public boolean PreviousRecord()
        PreviousRecord moves the record pointer to the next record in the business component, making that the current record and invoking any associated script events.
        Returns:

      • RefineQuery

        public void RefineQuery()
        This method refines a query after the query has been executed.

      • SetFieldValue

        public void SetFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                 java.lang.String fieldValue)
        SetFieldValue assigns the new value to the named field for the current row of the business component.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String containing the name of the field to assign the value to
        fieldValue - String containing the value to assign

      • SetFormattedFieldValue

        public void SetFormattedFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                          java.lang.String fieldValue)
        SetFormattedFieldValue assigns the new value to the named field for the current row of the business component. SetFormattedFieldValue accepts the field value in the current local format.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String containing the name of the field to assign the value to
        fieldValue - String containing the value to assign

      • SetSearchSpec

        public void SetSearchSpec(java.lang.String fieldName,
                 java.lang.String searchSpec)
        SetSearchSpec sets the search specification for a particular field. This method must be called before ExecuteQuery.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String containing the name of the field on which to set the search specification.
        searchSpec - String containing the search specification.

      • SetSearchExpr

        public void SetSearchExpr(java.lang.String searchexpr)
        SetSearchExpr sets an entire search expression on the business component, rather than setting one search specification for each field. Syntax is similar to that on the Predefined Queries screen.
        Parameters:
        searchexp - Search specification string field

      • SetSortSpec

        public void SetSortSpec(java.lang.String sortSpec)
        SetSortSpec sets the sort specification for a query.
        Parameters:
        sortSpec - String containing the sort specification

      • SetViewMode

        public void SetViewMode(int viewmode)
        SetViewMode sets the visibility type for the business component. This is used prior to a query
        Parameters:
        viewmode - viewmode value

      • UndoRecord

        public void UndoRecord()
        UndoRecord reverses any uncommitted changes made to the record. This includes reversing uncommitted modifications to fields, as well as deleting an active record that has not yet been committed to the database.

      • WriteRecord

        public void WriteRecord()
        Commits to the database any changes made to the current record.
